items.title: ‘Sing Sing’ Actor Jon-Adrian ‘JJ’ Velazquez Reflects on the Power of Prison Theater
items.description: JJ Velazquez served nearly 24 years for a murder he didn’t commit. A unique prison arts program transformed him into an actor and activist.

items.title: ‘Fear for Their Lives’: Trans Women Federal Prisoners Told They Will Be Housed With Men
items.description: After a minor change in a judge’s order, the Trump administration arranged to move over a dozen transgender women to men’s facilities.

items.title: He Refused to Become a Jailhouse Snitch. Can He Stop David Wood’s Execution?
items.description: Texas plans to execute Wood in March. George Hall says police encouraged him to lie about Wood confessing six murders to him.

items.title: Carroll Bogert Steps Down as President of The Marshall Project
items.description: Under her tenure, the organization saw robust growth, developed news products for incarcerated audiences, and expanded into three cities.

items.title: How a Guards’ Strike Plunged New York Prisons Into Turmoil and Why the Timing Is Curious
items.description: Correctional officers complain of unsafe conditions, but critics say the protests were meant to deflect attention from ‘a moment of reckoning.’
